section.description: Data attributes for the datatable control
section.name: Datatable

attribute.description: How many items to display per page in the datatable
attribute.name: data-page-length

attribute.description: All configuration options are detailed in the DataTables documentation
attribute.name: data-aopts

value.description: add a field to your repeat named: [repeat-name]-data-aopts, set the configurations there.
value.name: settings
value.value: ${ setting = (ISmartletField)smartlet.findFieldByName(field.getName() + "-data-aopts"); if(setting != null) { return setting.getValue(); } else { return ""; } }$

value.description: Example of an smartlet field defined as the id for the datatable
value.name: product_url

attribute.description: Configure your sort options for the datatable
attribute.name: sorts

attribute.description: Options for initialization of the datatable
attribute.name: init

attribute.description: Configure the wet-boew settings for your datatable
attribute.name: data-wb-tables

value.description: Method to set the configuration dynamically be using a settings field on the page.
value.name: settings
value.value: ${ setting = (ISmartletField)smartlet.findFieldByName(field.getName() + "-data-wb-tables"); if(setting != null) { return setting.getValue(); } else { return ""; } }$

attribute.description: Select an HTML Role attribute to apply
attribute.name: role

value.description: Open in a new window
value.name: _blank

value.description: Open in the parent window
value.name: _parent

value.description: Replace the content of the current window
value.name: _self

value.description: Open in the top most window
value.name: _top

value.description: Postal Code
value.name: A9A 9A9

attribute.description: values are; small, normal, large, xtra large
attribute.name: modal-size

value.description: Normal size modal, requires no class be specified.
value.name: modal-md

value.description: A new password. When creating a new account or changing passwords, this should be used for an "Enter your new password" or "Confirm new password" field, as opposed to a general "Enter your current password" field that might be present. This may be used by the browser both to avoid accidentally filling in an existing password and to offer assistance in creating a secure password (see also Preventing autofilling with autocomplete="new-password").
value.name: new-password

value.description: The browser is not permitted to automatically enter or select a value for this field. It is possible that the document or application provides its own autocomplete feature, or that security concerns require that the field's value not be automatically entered. Note: In most modern browsers, setting autocomplete to "off" will not prevent a password manager from asking the user if they would like to save username and password information, or from automatically filling in those values in a site's login form.
value.name: off

value.description: The browser is allowed to automatically complete the input. No guidance is provided as to the type of data expected in the field, so the browser may use its own judgement.
value.name: on

value.description: The field expects the value to be a person's full name. Using "name" rather than breaking the name down into its components is generally preferred because it avoids dealing with the wide diversity of human names and how they are structured
value.name: name

value.description: The prefix or title, such as "Mrs.", "Mr.", "Miss", "Ms.", "Dr.", or "Mlle.".
value.name: honorific-prefix

value.description: The given (or "first") name.
value.name: Tiven-name

value.description: The middle name.
value.name: additional-name

value.description: The family (or "last") name.
value.name: family-name

value.description: The suffix, such as "Jr.", "B.Sc.", "PhD.", "MBASW", or "IV".
value.name: honorific-suffix

value.description: A nickname or handle.
value.name: nickname

value.description: An email address.
value.name: email

value.description: A username or account name.
value.name: username

value.description: The user's current password.
value.name: current-password

value.description: A one-time code used for verifying user identity.
value.name: one-time-code

value.description: A job title, or the title a person has within an organization, such as "Senior Technical Writer", "President", or "Assistant Troop Leader".
value.name: organization-title

value.description: A company or organization name, such as "Acme Widget Company" or "Girl Scouts of America".
value.name: organization

value.description: A street address. This can be multiple lines of text, and should fully identify the location of the address within its second administrative level (typically a city or town), but should not include the city name, ZIP or postal code, or country name.
value.name: street-address

value.description: Each individual line of the street address. These should only be present if the "street-address" is not present.
value.name: address-line1

value.description: Each individual line of the street address. These should only be present if the "street-address" is not present.
value.name: address-line2

value.description: Each individual line of the street address. These should only be present if the "street-address" is not present.
value.name: address-line3

value.description: The finest-grained administrative level, in addresses which have four levels.
value.name: address-level4

value.description: The third administrative level, in addresses with at least three administrative levels.
value.name: address-level3

value.description: The second administrative level, in addresses with at least two of them. In countries with two administrative levels, this would typically be the city, town, village, or other locality in which the address is located.
value.name: address-level2

value.description: The first administrative level in the address. This is typically the province in which the address is located. In the United States, this would be the state. In Switzerland, the canton. In the United Kingdom, the post town.
value.name: address-level1

value.description: A country or territory code.
value.name: country

value.description: A country or territory name.
value.name: country-name

value.description: A postal code (in the United States, this is the ZIP code).
value.name: postal-code

value.description: The full name as printed on or associated with a payment instrument such as a credit card. Using a full name field is preferred, typically, over breaking the name into pieces.
value.name: cc-name

value.description: A given (first) name as given on a payment instrument like a credit card.
value.name: cc-given-name

value.description: A middle name as given on a payment instrument or credit card.
value.name: cc-additional-name

value.description: A family name, as given on a credit card.
value.name: cc-family-name

value.description: A credit card number or other number identifying a payment method, such as an account number.
value.name: cc-number

value.description: A payment method expiration date, typically in the form "MM/YY" or "MM/YYYY".
value.name: cc-exp

value.description: The month in which the payment method expires.
value.name: cc-exp-month

value.description: The year in which the payment method expires.
value.name: cc-exp-year

value.description: The security code for the payment instrument; on credit cards, this is the 3-digit verification number on the back of the card.
value.name: cc-csc

value.description: The type of payment instrument (such as "Visa" or "Master Card").
value.name: cc-type

value.description: The currency in which the transaction is to take place.
value.name: transaction-currency

value.description: The amount, given in the currency specified by "transaction-currency", of the transaction, for a payment form.
value.name: transaction-amount

value.description: A preferred language, given as a valid BCP 47 language tag.
value.name: language

value.description: A birth date, as a full date.
value.name: bday

value.description: The day of the month of a birth date.
value.name: bday-day

value.description: The month of the year of a birth date.
value.name: bday-month

value.description: The year of a birth date.
value.name: bday-year

value.description: A gender identity (such as "Female", "Fa'afafine", "Male"), as freeform text without newlines.
value.name: sex

value.description: A full telephone number, including the country code.
value.name: tel

value.description: The country code, such as "1" for the United States, Canada, and other areas in North America and parts of the Caribbean.
value.name: tel-country-code

value.description: The entire phone number without the country code component, including a country-internal prefix. For the phone number "1-855-555-6502", this field's value would be "855-555-6502".
value.name: tel-national

value.description: The area code, with any country-internal prefix applied if appropriate.
value.name: tel-area-code

value.description: The phone number without the country or area code. This can be split further into two parts, for phone numbers which have an exchange number and then a number within the exchange. For the phone number "555-6502", use "tel-local-prefix" for "555" and "tel-local-suffix" for "6502".
value.name: tel-local

value.description: A telephone extension code within the phone number, such as a room or suite number in a hotel or an office extension in a company.
value.name: tel-extension

value.description: A URL for an instant messaging protocol endpoint, such as "xmpp:username@example.net".
value.name: impp

value.description: A URL, such as a home page or company web site address as appropriate given the context of the other fields in the form.
value.name: url

value.description: The URL of an image representing the person, company, or contact information given in the other fields in the form.
value.name: photo

attribute.description: HTML Controls and other advanced components
attribute.name: Controls

value.description: When using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: h1

value.description: When using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: h2

value.description: The <span> tag is an inline container used to mark up a part of a text, or a part of a document. When using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: span

value.description: When using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: h3

value.description: When using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: h4

value.description: When using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: h5

value.description: When using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: h6

value.description: Paragraph, when using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: p

value.description: When using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: ul

value.description: vhen using a group field, the fields inside the group will not render in bootstrap columns.
value.name: li

value.description: The <a> tag defines a hyperlink, which is used to link from one page to another. When using a group field, The href attribute will be set using the label attribute and the contents of the group will be its label. Otherwise, the href will use the value attribute.
value.name: a

value.description: Render this group using the datatable control
value.name: datatables

value.description: Render a <script></script> bloc using content from value
value.name: Javascript

value.description: Text in a <pre> element is displayed in a fixed-width font, and the text preserves both spaces and line breaks. The text will be displayed exactly as written in the HTML source code.
value.name: pre
